description: The tmnxEthTunnelApsCfgRaiseAlarm is generated when an Ethernet Tunnel
Group working and protection configuration mismatch is detected, at the
ETH layer, by detecting the reception of APS protocol from the working
transport entity.
REFERENCE ITU-T Rec G.8021/Y.1341 (12/2007) Section 6.1.4.3.3

event.Summary: Ethernet tunnel group working and protection configuration mismatch detected

description: The value of tmnxEthTunnelApsDefectStatus indicates what defects are
active on the Ethernet Tunnel Group.
The Defects are defined as:
dFopCM -- Configuration Mismatch
dFopPM -- Provisioning Mismatch
dFopNR -- Protocol No Response
variables.name: TIMETRA-ETH-TUNNEL-MIB::tmnxEthTunnelApsDefectStatus

description: The tmnxEthTunnelApsCfgClearAlarm is generated when an Ethernet Tunnel
Group working and protection configuration mismatch is cleared.
REFERENCE ITU-T Rec G.8021/Y.1341 (12/2007) Section 6.1.4.3.3

event.Summary: Ethernet tunnel group working and protection configuration mismatch is cleared

description: The value of tmnxEthTunnelApsDefectStatus indicates what defects are
active on the Ethernet Tunnel Group.
The Defects are defined as:
dFopCM -- Configuration Mismatch
dFopPM -- Provisioning Mismatch
dFopNR -- Protocol No Response
variables.name: TIMETRA-ETH-TUNNEL-MIB::tmnxEthTunnelApsDefectStatus

description: The tmnxEthTunnelApsPrvsnRaiseAlarm is generated when an Ethernet
Tunnel Group provisioning mismatch is detected, at the ETH layer, by
comparing A, B and D bits of the transmitted and received APS
protocol.
The provision mismatch state is considered as if there is a signal
failure on the protection member. This ensures that the working member
is kept as active member in the provision mismatch state.
REFERENCE ITU-T Rec G.8021/Y.1341 (12/2007) Section 6.1.4.3.1

event.Summary: Ethernet tunnel group provisioning mismatch detected

description: The value of tmnxEthTunnelApsDefectStatus indicates what defects are
active on the Ethernet Tunnel Group.
The Defects are defined as:
dFopCM -- Configuration Mismatch
dFopPM -- Provisioning Mismatch
dFopNR -- Protocol No Response
variables.name: TIMETRA-ETH-TUNNEL-MIB::tmnxEthTunnelApsDefectStatus

description: The value of tmnxEthTunnelApsRxPdu indicates the PDU last received on
the Ethernet Tunnel Group.
variables.name: TIMETRA-ETH-TUNNEL-MIB::tmnxEthTunnelApsRxPdu

description: The value of tmnxEthTunnelApsTxPdu indicates the PDU last transmitted
on the Ethernet Tunnel Group.
variables.name: TIMETRA-ETH-TUNNEL-MIB::tmnxEthTunnelApsTxPdu

description: The tmnxEthTunnelApsPrvsnClearAlarm is generated when an Ethernet
Tunnel Group provisioning mismatch is cleared.
REFERENCE ITU-T Rec G.8021/Y.1341 (12/2007) Section 6.1.4.3.1

event.Summary: Ethernet tunnel group provisioning mismatch is cleared

description: The value of tmnxEthTunnelApsDefectStatus indicates what defects are
active on the Ethernet Tunnel Group.
The Defects are defined as:
dFopCM -- Configuration Mismatch
dFopPM -- Provisioning Mismatch
dFopNR -- Protocol No Response
variables.name: TIMETRA-ETH-TUNNEL-MIB::tmnxEthTunnelApsDefectStatus

description: The value of tmnxEthTunnelApsRxPdu indicates the PDU last received on
the Ethernet Tunnel Group.
variables.name: TIMETRA-ETH-TUNNEL-MIB::tmnxEthTunnelApsRxPdu

description: The value of tmnxEthTunnelApsTxPdu indicates the PDU last transmitted
on the Ethernet Tunnel Group.
variables.name: TIMETRA-ETH-TUNNEL-MIB::tmnxEthTunnelApsTxPdu

description: The tmnxEthTunnelApsNoRspRaiseAlarm is generated when an Ethernet
Tunnel Group experiences an incompletion of protection switching, at
the ETH layer, by comparing the transmitted 'Requested Signal' values
and the received 'Bridged Signal' in the APS protocol.
REFERENCE ITU-T Rec G.8021/Y.1341 (12/2007) Section 6.1.4.3.2

event.Summary: Ethernet tunnel group experienced an incomplete protection switching at ETH layer

description: The value of tmnxEthTunnelApsDefectStatus indicates what defects are
active on the Ethernet Tunnel Group.
The Defects are defined as:
dFopCM -- Configuration Mismatch
dFopPM -- Provisioning Mismatch
dFopNR -- Protocol No Response
variables.name: TIMETRA-ETH-TUNNEL-MIB::tmnxEthTunnelApsDefectStatus

description: The tmnxEthTunnelApsNoRspClearAlarm is generated when an Ethernet
Tunnel Group no longer experiences an incompletion of protection
switching at the ETH layer.
REFERENCE ITU-T Rec G.8021/Y.1341 (12/2007) Section 6.1.4.3.2

event.Summary: Ethernet tunnel group has not experienced an incomplete protection switching

description: The value of tmnxEthTunnelApsDefectStatus indicates what defects are
active on the Ethernet Tunnel Group.
The Defects are defined as:
dFopCM -- Configuration Mismatch
dFopPM -- Provisioning Mismatch
dFopNR -- Protocol No Response
variables.name: TIMETRA-ETH-TUNNEL-MIB::tmnxEthTunnelApsDefectStatus

description: The tmnxEthTunnelApsSwitchoverAlarm is generated when an Ethernet
Tunnel Group experiences a member activity switchover.
The tmnxEthTunnelMemberPrecedence always specifies the active member.

event.Summary: ETH tunnel APS switchover alarm occurred

description: The value of tmnxEthTunnelMemberPrecedence specifies the precedence
level of the Member.
When tmnxEthTunnelProtectionType of the group is set to
'g8031-1to1 (1)', only two precedence values are valid, and each member
MUST have a different precedence.
0 - This is considered the primary member, or the
working member.
1 - This is considered the secondary member, or the
protection member.
When tmnxEthTunnelProtectionType is set to the value 'loadsharing (2)'
the precedence of all members should be the same.
variables.name: TIMETRA-ETH-TUNNEL-MIB::tmnxEthTunnelMemberPrecedence
